meanings.definition: The first of the three names of a Roman citizen, used in personal address.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, the praenomina was like a modern first name.
meanings.sent2: When greeting a Roman citizen, you would use their praenomina.
meanings.sent3: The praenomina was so important that it distinguished one citizen from another.
meanings.sent4: Her praenomina shone brightly among the sea of Roman names.
meanings.sent5: The praenomina echoed through the marble halls of the Roman forum.

meanings.sent1: Each Roman had a unique praenomina that set them apart.
meanings.sent2: The praenomina was often passed down through generations in Roman families.
meanings.sent3: His praenomina sounded regal, fitting for a citizen of Rome.
meanings.sent4: The praenomina carried the weight of Roman history on its shoulders.
meanings.sent5: She proudly wore her praenomina like a badge of honor.
